bibl.title: Letter from Theodore C. Lyster to Henry Rose Carter, February 3, 1923

div1.p: Lyster sends Carter a report on the yellow fever campaign in Vera Cruz, Mexico and a letter Lyster has written to Houle commenting on the campaign.

div1.head: Letter from Theodore C. Lyster to Henry Rose Carter, February 3, 1923
div1.opener:
I. H. B.
Lyster
THEODORE C. LYSTER, M. D.
EUGENE R. LEWIS, M. D.
ISAAC H. JONES, M. D.
SAMUEL D. INGHAM, M. D.
1920 OHAXOE, XEAR WESTLAXK
LOS ANGELES
February 3rd, 1923.
Dr. H. P. Carter,
Cor California St. near Connecticutt,
Washington, D. C.,
Dear Doctor Carter:-
div1.p:
Houle has done excellent work as you will see
from this report enc. 1; enc. 2 and I am sure will appreciate any interest you might
take in writing him, and any suggestions, as he is exactly the sort of
fellow who would appreciate it.
div1.closer:
Sincerely, T. C. Lyster, M. D. T CL/D.
Encl.
